intro: Morinda bracteata var. celebica, commonly known as the Celebes morinda, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. The fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature, attracting various birds and small mammals.
